title: Introduction to respirometr
text: respirometr package provides tools processing analyzing respirometry data LI-COR gas analyzers. currently supports data LI-850 LI-7000 analyzers, making easier work common instruments R.

title: Introduction to respirometr
text: can install respirometr GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("roaldarbol/respirometr")

title: Introduction to respirometr
text: First, load package:
code: library(respirometr)

previous_headings: Get Started with respirometr > Basic Usage
title: Introduction to respirometr
text: package provides specialized functions reading data different LI-COR analyzers: functions automatically: - Handle specific file formats analyzer - Clean column names easier use R - Remove columns NA values - Convert time standardized format
code: # Read data from a LI-850 analyzer li850_data <- read_licor_li850("path/to/LI850.txt")  # Read data from a LI-7000 analyzer li7000_data <- read_licor_li7000("path/to/LI7000.txt")

previous_headings: Get Started with respirometr > Basic Usage
title: Introduction to respirometr
text: package provides two methods normalizing drift measurements:
code: # Using linear interpolation between means normalized_data <- normalise_drift_means(   data = measurements,   pre = pre_measurement_values,   post = post_measurement_values )  # Using linear regression normalized_data <- normalise_drift_lm(   data = data,   data_pre = pre_measurements,   data_post = post_measurements,   colname_time = "time",   colname_measure = "co2d_um_m" )

text: Check reference documentation detailed information function See articles section -depth tutorials examples Visit GitHub repository latest updates report issues

what: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: Converts CO2 measurements gas analyzer data standardized units, options temperature correction. function handles regular sampling intervals (specified sampling frequency) irregular intervals (specified time vector). can process single measurements vectors measurements. function implements standard gas analysis conversions can optionally apply temperature corrections using Q10 = 2 approach (metabolic rate doubles every 10°C increase).

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
code: convert_unit_co2(   co2_value,   time = NULL,   sampling_rate = NULL,   flow_rate,   from_temperature = NULL,   to_temperature = NULL,   unit_input_co2 = "umol/mol",   unit_output_time = "min",   unit_output_vol = "umol",   unit_flowrate = "mL/min" )

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: co2_value Numeric vector. differential CO2 value(s) gas analyzer (default μmol/mol ppm) time Numeric vector. Optional vector timestamps seconds. provided, must length co2_value. Use irregular sampling intervals gaps data. sampling_rate Numeric. sampling frequency Hz (e.g., use 30 30 Hz sampling). Ignored time provided. used regular sampling intervals. flow_rate Numeric. flow rate gas system. from_temperature Numeric. Optional source temperature Celsius. Must provided together to_temperature temperature correction desired. to_temperature Numeric. Optional target temperature Celsius. Must provided together from_temperature temperature correction desired. unit_input_co2 Character. Input CO2 unit, either "uM/M" "umol/mol" (equivalent ppm). Default: "umol/mol" unit_output_time Character. Desired time unit output rate, one "sec", "min", "hr". Default: "min" unit_output_vol Character. Desired volume unit output, either "umol" "uL". Default: "umol" unit_flowrate Character. Flow rate unit, either "mL/min" "mL/hr". Default: "mL/min"

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: Numeric vector converted CO2 values specified output units

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: function performs following conversions: Converts CO2 measurements ppm (μmol/mol) fractions Calculates time intervals either sampling rate timestamps Applies flow rate conversion needed Optionally applies temperature correction using Q10 = 2 Converts desired output units Temperature correction uses formula: correction_factor = 10^((to_temperature - from_temperature) * (log10(2)/10))

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: using sampling_rate, provide frequency Hz (e.g., 30 30 Hz sampling), period (e.g., 1/30).

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
text: Temperature correction method based standard Q10 = 2 approach, metabolic rate doubles every 10°C increase temperature.

title: Convert CO2 measurements from gas analyzer data — convert_unit_co2
code: # Basic usage with 2 Hz sampling convert_unit_co2(   co2_value = 100,   sampling_rate = 2,   flow_rate = 1300,   unit_output_time = "hr",   unit_output_vol = "uL" ) #> [1] 20966.4  # Using timestamps for irregular sampling convert_unit_co2(   co2_value = c(100, 102, 98),   time = c(0, 1.5, 3.2),   flow_rate = 1300,   unit_output_time = "hr",   unit_output_vol = "uL" ) #> [1]      Inf 7128.576 6043.256  # With temperature correction convert_unit_co2(   co2_value = 100,   sampling_rate = 30,    # 30 Hz sampling   flow_rate = 200,   from_temperature = 17, # Experiment temperature   to_temperature = 25,   # Standard temperature   unit_output_vol = "uL",   unit_output_time = "min" ) #> [1] 1404.024  # Processing a sequence of measurements co2_values <- c(95, 98, 100, 103, 99) times <- seq(0, 8, by = 2)  # Measurements every 2 seconds convert_unit_co2(   co2_value = co2_values,   time = times,   flow_rate = 200,   unit_output_vol = "uL",   unit_output_time = "min" ) #> [1]     Inf 13.1712 13.4400 13.8432 13.3056

what: Ensure that column types are not all characters — ensure_column_types
title: Ensure that column types are not all characters — ensure_column_types
text: Ensure column types characters. sometimes occurs machine re-initiates column headers twice data set.

title: Ensure that column types are not all characters — ensure_column_types
code: ensure_column_types(data)

what: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
text: function normalizes measurement data subtracting baseline values predicted linear regression pre post data.

title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
code: normalise_drift_lm(   data,   data_pre,   data_post,   colname_time = "time",   colname_measure = "co2d_um_m" )

title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
text: data data frame containing main dataset normalized data_pre data frame containing pre-experiment data used baseline calculation data_post data frame containing post-experiment data used baseline calculation colname_time Character string specifying column name time measurements. Default "time". colname_measure Character string specifying column name measurement. Default "co2d_um_m".

title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
text: modified version input data baseline-adjusted measurements

title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
text: function performs following steps: Combines pre post data Fits linear regression model using time predictor Predicts baseline values main dataset Subtracts baseline values original measurements

title: Normalize Measurement Data Using Linear Regression — normalise_drift_lm
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assuming you have pre, post, and main datasets normalized_data <- normalise_drift_lm(   data = main_data,   data_pre = pre_experiment_data,   data_post = post_experiment_data ) } # }

what: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
text: function normalizes data vector subtracting linear interpolation means pre post measurements. useful correcting measurement drift experimental data.

title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
code: normalise_drift_means(data, pre, post)

title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
text: data Numeric vector containing measurements normalized pre Numeric vector single value representing pre-measurement(s) post Numeric vector single value representing post-measurement(s)

title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
text: numeric vector length data containing normalized values

title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
text: function performs following steps: Calculates mean pre-measurements multiple values provided Calculates mean post-measurements multiple values provided Creates linear interpolation pre post means Subtracts interpolated values data correct drift

title: Normalize Data for Linear Drift Between Pre and Post Measurements — normalise_drift_means
code: # Single pre/post values data <- c(15, 16, 17, 18, 19) normalise_drift_means(data, pre = 10, post = 20) #> Corrected for linear drift between 10 and 20 #> [1]  5.0  3.5  2.0  0.5 -1.0  # Multiple pre/post values normalise_drift_means(   data = c(15, 16, 17, 18, 19),   pre = c(10, 11, 12),   post = c(19, 20, 21) ) #> Using mean of 3 pre-measurements: 11 #> Using mean of 3 post-measurements: 20 #> Corrected for linear drift between 11 and 20 #> [1]  4.00  2.75  1.50  0.25 -1.00

what: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
title: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
text: Creates visualization time series data. Useful analyzing patterns continuous measurements physiological data single-trace recordings.

title: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
code: plot_timeseries(data, value_col, time_col = "time", y_max = NULL)

title: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
text: data data frame containing time series data following columns: Time column (specified time_col, defaults "time") Column specified value_col containing values plot value_col Character string specifying column plot time_col Character string specifying time column (default: "time") y_max Optional numeric value specifying maximum value y-axis. NULL (default), y-axis limit automatically determined data.

title: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
text: ggplot object wrapped patchwork.

title: Plot Time Series of Values — plot_timeseries
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot heart rate data plot_timeseries(physio_data, value_col = "heart_rate")  # Plot temperature with custom time column plot_timeseries(physio_data,                value_col = "temperature",                time_col = "timestamp") } # }

title: Read Licor data — read_licor
text: Read respirometry data variety Licor devices.

title: Read Licor data — read_licor
code: read_licor(filepath, model)

title: Read Licor data — read_licor
text: filepath Path file model LiCor model

title: Read Licor data — read_licor
text: Tidy LiCor data

what: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
text: Reads data LI-7000 CO2/H2O analyzer file, cleans column names, ensures proper time column handling. Handles cases headers repeated mid-file.

title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
code: read_licor_li7000(filepath)

title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
text: filepath Character string specifying path LI-7000 data file. File tab-separated two header rows.

title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
text: tibble containing processed LI-7000 data : original columns cleaned names (lowercase, spaces) Standardized time column Data combined across mid-file header breaks

title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
text: function performs following operations: Reads entire file lines Identifies removes mid-file headers Cleans column names using janitor::make_clean_names() Ensures proper time column naming

title: Read and Process LI-7000 Data Files — read_licor_li7000
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Read a LI-7000 data file data <- read_licor_li7000("path/to/li7000_data.txt") } # }

what: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
text: Reads data LI-850 CO2/H2O analyzer file, cleans column names, removes columns NA values, adds elapsed time column. Handles cases headers repeated mid-file.

title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
code: read_licor_li850(filepath)

title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
text: filepath Character string specifying path LI-850 data file. File tab-separated one-line header.

title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
text: tibble containing processed LI-850 data : original columns except containing NA values Cleaned column names (lowercase, spaces) system_time_h_m_s converted HMS format New time column seconds elapsed start Data combined across mid-file header breaks

title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
text: function performs following operations: Reads entire file handles mid-file headers Cleans column names using janitor::make_clean_names() Removes columns containing NA values Converts system time HMS format Adds elapsed time column seconds

title: Read and Process LI-850 Data Files — read_licor_li850
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Read a LI-850 data file data <- read_licor_li850("path/to/li850_data.txt") } # }

title: respirometr 0.2.0
text: Added normalise_drift_lm() correct measurement drift using linear regression Added normalise_drift_means() correct measurement drift using linear interpolation pre/post means

title: respirometr 0.2.0
text: Enhanced documentation read_licor_li850() read_licor_li7000() Added comprehensive test suite main functions Added input validation informative error messages using cli package UK (normalise) US (normalize) spelling variants now supported drift correction functions

title: respirometr 0.1.1
text: Added proper pre-post normalisation Fixes bug caused files read.

title: respirometr 0.1.0
text: Initial version.
